title: Fed Debates Over Going Restrictive, Netflix Growth Restores Faith, Endowments Go Crypto
itunes:title: Fed Debates Over Going Restrictive, Netflix Growth Restores Faith, Endowments Go Crypto
description:
Tim Mahedy Economist for Bloomberg Economics and Bloomberg Stocks Editor Dave Wilson discuss Federal Reserve officials stepping deeper into a debate over how high to push interest rates, with a majority appearing to favor an eventual and temporary move above the level they deem neutral for the economy in the long run. Dan Morgan, Senior Portfolio Manager at Synovus Trust, breaks down Netflix growing faster than even its most bullish fans on Wall Street predicted, soothing doubts about its global prospects and sending its already-stratospheric stock higher. Janet Lorin, Bloomberg News Endowments Reporter, discusses her story in Businessweek Magazine about colleges entering the crypto era. Jon Erlichman, Anchor of BNN Bloomberg's The Open, explains what legalizing marijuana will mean for Canadian businesses. Margaret Newkirk, Bloomberg News Reporter, shares her story in Businessweek Magazine about Democrats pinning their midterm hopes on registering new voters. And we Drive to the Close of the market with Janet Rilling, Head of Multi Sector Fixed Income at Wells Fargo Asset Management.

 Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
